error.signature: Type 'T' is not assignable to type 'T extends U ? X : Y'

verdict.summary: Conditional types are not resolved when the type parameter is still generic. Use type narrowing or overloads instead.

dead_ends.action: Add type assertions at every conditional type usage
dead_ends.why_fails: Assertions bypass the type system; if the condition is wrong, runtime errors occur

workarounds.action: Use function overloads instead of conditional return types
Use Extract/Exclude utility types to simplify conditional types
workarounds.how:
type StringOnly = Extract<MyUnion, string>;
type NonString = Exclude<MyUnion, string>;

leads_to.condition: When conditional types create recursive type references

preceded_by.condition: When generic constraints interact with conditional types

frequently_confused_with.distinction: TS2322 is general type mismatch; conditional type errors involve deferred type resolution in generics
